clusters.title: Zelenskyy condemns Russia’s ‘vile and cowardly’ 12-hour bombing of Ukraine
clusters.neutral_headline: Russia Attacks Kyiv with Drones and Missiles, Killing Civilians

items.title: Zelenskyy condemns Russia’s ‘vile and cowardly’ 12-hour bombing of Ukraine
items.standfirst: Moscow targets Kyiv and other regions with about 600 drones and 40 missiles, killing at least four peopleOne of the worst bombardments of Kyiv since the start of Vladimir Putin’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine has killed at least four people in what Volodymyr Zelenskyy described as a “vile and cowardly” attack.Russia launched nearly 600 drones and more than 40 cruise missiles in a bombardment that lasted more than 12 hours over Saturday night and into Sunday morning. The main targets were the Ukrainian capital and the regions of Zaporizhzhia, Khmelnytskyi, Sumy, Mykolaiv, Chernihiv and Odesa. Continue reading...
items.content: Moscow targets Kyiv and other regions with about 600 drones and 40 missiles, killing at least four peopleOne of the worst bombardments of Kyiv since the start of Vladimir Putin’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine has killed at least four people in what Volodymyr Zelenskyy described as a “vile and cowardly” attack.Russia launched nearly 600 drones and more than 40 cruise missiles in a bombardment that lasted more than 12 hours over Saturday night and into Sunday morning. The main targets were the Ukrainian capital and the regions of Zaporizhzhia, Khmelnytskyi, Sumy, Mykolaiv, Chernihiv and Odesa. Continue reading...

items.title: Russia bombards Kyiv in lengthy attack
items.standfirst: Russia bombarded Ukraine on Sunday in an attack that lasted for more than 12 hours and killed at least four people in Kyiv. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said the assault was further evidence of the need for more international sanctions on Moscow and to cut off its energy revenues; last…
items.content: Russia bombarded Ukraine on Sunday in an attack that lasted for more than 12 hours and killed at least four people in Kyiv. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said the assault was further evidence of the need for more international sanctions on Moscow and to cut off its energy revenues; last…

items.title: NATO Scrambles Fighter Jets As Russia Launches 12-Hour Barrage on Ukraine
items.standfirst: Poland restricts airspace and deploys fighter jets in response to major Russian assault on Ukraine.
items.content: Poland restricts airspace and deploys fighter jets in response to major Russian assault on Ukraine.

items.title: Ukraine: Massive Russian missile and drone barrage kills at least four in Kyiv
items.standfirst: Russia pounded Ukraine for hours with hundreds of drones and missiles overnight, killing at least four people, including a 12-year-old girl, Kyiv said Sunday. Story by Axelle Simon and Olivia Bizot.
items.content: Russia pounded Ukraine for hours with hundreds of drones and missiles overnight, killing at least four people, including a 12-year-old girl, Kyiv said Sunday. Story by Axelle Simon and Olivia Bizot.

items.title: Heavy Russian drone attack kills at least four in Ukraine’s capital Kyiv
items.standfirst: Russia has launched a heavy attack on Ukraine with hundreds of kamikaze drones hitting residential buildings in Kyiv.
items.content: Russia has launched a heavy attack on Ukraine with hundreds of kamikaze drones hitting residential buildings in Kyiv.

items.title: 'Hundreds' of drones and missiles fired at Ukraine by Russia
items.standfirst: At least four people have been killed in Kyiv following a Russian aerial bombardment across Ukraine, President Volodymyr Zelensky said.
items.content: At least four people have been killed in Kyiv following a Russian aerial bombardment across Ukraine, President Volodymyr Zelensky said.

items.title: Ukraine: Kyiv hit by massive Russian drone and missile attack
items.standfirst: Russia launched hundreds of drones and missiles at Kyiv and other parts of Ukraine early on Sunday, killing at least four people and injuring dozens, in one of the most sustained attacks on the capital since the full-scale war began. Story by FRANCE 24's Kyiv correspondent Aidan Stretch.
items.content: Russia launched hundreds of drones and missiles at Kyiv and other parts of Ukraine early on Sunday, killing at least four people and injuring dozens, in one of the most sustained attacks on the capital since the full-scale war began. Story by FRANCE 24's Kyiv correspondent Aidan Stretch.

items.title: Russian missiles and drones pound Ukraine in ‘savage’ 12-hour attack
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says assault involved nearly 500 drones and more than 40 missiles
items.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says assault involved nearly 500 drones and more than 40 missiles

items.title: Russia launches deadly aerial attack on Ukraine as Poland scrambles jets
items.standfirst: Russia launched a massive aerial assault on Ukraine’s capital and across the country early Sunday, killing at least four people, including a 12-year-old girl, the Ukrainian government said.
items.content: Russia launched a massive aerial assault on Ukraine’s capital and across the country early Sunday, killing at least four people, including a 12-year-old girl, the Ukrainian government said.

items.title: Russia launches massive attack on Kyiv - as Poland scrambles jets and closes airspace
items.standfirst: Russia has launched a massive drone and missile attack on Ukraine's capital this morning, killing four people and injuring about 10, Kyiv's military administration has said.
items.content: Russia has launched a massive drone and missile attack on Ukraine's capital this morning, killing four people and injuring about 10, Kyiv's military administration has said.

ai_summary: Russia launched a large-scale attack on Kyiv and other regions, lasting over 12 hours.
The attack involved approximately 600 drones and over 40 cruise missiles.
At least four people were killed in Kyiv, including a 12-year-old girl.
Ukrainian President Zelenskyy called for more international sanctions on Russia.
Poland deployed fighter jets and restricted airspace in response to the attack.

items.content: A lone gunman opened fire inside a Mormon church in the US state of Michigan during Sunday services before the building was set on fire. At least one person was killed and nine injured before the police shot the gunman.

ai_summary: A shooting occurred during a Sunday service at a church in Grand Blanc, Michigan.
At least one person died, and nine others were hospitalized due to the shooting.
The suspect, a 40-year-old man, drove a vehicle into the church.
Authorities believe the suspect set a fire inside the church before opening fire.
President Trump reacted to the shooting, urging an end to violence.

clusters.title: Stampede at political rally for popular actor Vijay in southern India leaves 40 dead
clusters.neutral_headline: Stampede at Indian Political Rally Kills Dozens

items.title: Stampede at political rally for popular actor Vijay in southern India leaves 40 dead
items.standfirst: The death toll following a stampede at a political rally for a popular Indian actor and politician in the southern state of Tamil Nadu has climbed to 40, the state’s health minister said Sunday, as medics treated at least 124 injured in hospitals.
items.content: The death toll following a stampede at a political rally for a popular Indian actor and politician in the southern state of Tamil Nadu has climbed to 40, the state’s health minister said Sunday, as medics treated at least 124 injured in hospitals.

items.title: At least 40 dead in crush at political rally in India
items.standfirst: Tens of thousands had gathered at a campaign event for actor-turned-politician Vijay in India's southern state of Tamil Nadu.
items.content: Tens of thousands had gathered at a campaign event for actor-turned-politician Vijay in India's southern state of Tamil Nadu.

items.title: Police investigate Indian actor's campaign rally after 40 people killed
items.standfirst: Police in India are investigating after 40 people died in a stampede at a political rally that officials said was much larger than expected.
items.content: Police in India are investigating after 40 people died in a stampede at a political rally that officials said was much larger than expected.

items.title: Crowd crush kills dozens in India at political rally for Tamil actor Vijay
items.standfirst: A crowd crush at a campaign rally for popular actor-turned-politician Vijay has killed at least 39 people in Karur.
items.content: A crowd crush at a campaign rally for popular actor-turned-politician Vijay has killed at least 39 people in Karur.

items.title: Stampede at a political rally for popular actor Vijay in southern India kills 36, injures 40
items.standfirst: A stampede at a rally for a popular Indian actor and politician in the southern state of Tamil Nadu killed at least 36 people and injured 40 others.
items.content: A stampede at a rally for a popular Indian actor and politician in the southern state of Tamil Nadu killed at least 36 people and injured 40 others.(Image credit: Uncredited)

ai_summary: A stampede occurred at a political rally for actor Vijay in Tamil Nadu, India.
The death toll from the stampede has reached at least 40 people.
At least 124 people were injured and receiving treatment in hospitals.
Tens of thousands attended the campaign event for the actor-turned-politician.
Police are investigating the cause of the stampede at the rally.

clusters.title: Eric Adams drops out of New York City mayor's race
clusters.neutral_headline: Eric Adams Drops Out of New York City Mayoral Race

items.title: Eric Adams drops out of New York City mayor's race
items.standfirst: New York City Mayor Eric Adams is dropping his bid for reelection, setting up a three-way race between Zohran Mamdani, Andrew Cuomo and Curtis Sliwa.
items.content: New York City Mayor Eric Adams is dropping his bid for reelection, setting up a three-way race between Zohran Mamdani, Andrew Cuomo and Curtis Sliwa.

items.title: New York City Mayor Eric Adams drops reelection bid
items.standfirst: New York City Mayor Eric Adams announced Sunday he's ending his reelection campaign. The move sets up a three-way race between Queens Assemblyman Zohran Mamdani, former New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo and Guardian Angels founder Curtis Sliwa to lead America's largest city.
items.content: New York City Mayor Eric Adams announced Sunday he's ending his reelection campaign. The move sets up a three-way race between Queens Assemblyman Zohran Mamdani, former New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo and Guardian Angels founder Curtis Sliwa to lead America's largest city.

items.title: Eric Adams drops out of New York City mayoral race
items.standfirst: New York City mayor abandons faltering bid to win re-election in social media video set to strains of song My WayThe mayor of New York City, Eric Adams, announced on Sunday that he is abandoning his faltering bid to win re-election, just over a month before election day, delivering the message in a social media video set to the strains of My Way.Adams, who was trailing in the polls, was elected as a Democrat but ran for re-election as an independent after he was indicted on federal corruption charges, which were then dropped by the Trump administration in exchange for his cooperation on immigration raids. Continue reading...
items.content: New York City mayor abandons faltering bid to win re-election in social media video set to strains of song My WayThe mayor of New York City, Eric Adams, announced on Sunday that he is abandoning his faltering bid to win re-election, just over a month before election day, delivering the message in a social media video set to the strains of My Way.Adams, who was trailing in the polls, was elected as a Democrat but ran for re-election as an independent after he was indicted on federal corruption charges, which were then dropped by the Trump administration in exchange for his cooperation on immigration raids. Continue reading...

items.content: New York Mayor Eric Adams said Sunday that he is dropping out of the mayoral race and abandoning his campaign but didn't endorse Andrew Cuomo or Zohran Mamdani.

items.content: New York City Mayor Eric Adams announced on Sunday that he is dropping his third-party bid for re-election, narrowing the field for November's election.

ai_summary: New York City Mayor Eric Adams ended his bid for reelection.
The announcement was made in a social media video.
The race is now between Zohran Mamdani, Andrew Cuomo, and Curtis Sliwa.
Adams was trailing in polls and faced challenges raising funds.
Adams was elected as a Democrat but ran as an independent.

items.standfirst: The luxury department store said it was working with authorities, and the affected data was limited to basic details.
items.content: The luxury department store said it was working with authorities, and the affected data was limited to basic details.

items.title: Harrods Warns Customers of Data Theft in Latest IT Breach
items.standfirst: Customers of Harrods Ltd., the luxury London department store, had their personal data stolen, the latest in a string of cyberattacks and IT breaches affecting major UK businesses this year.
items.content: Customers of Harrods Ltd., the luxury London department store, had their personal data stolen, the latest in a string of cyberattacks and IT breaches affecting major UK businesses this year.

items.title: Harrods warns customers their data may have been stolen in IT breach
items.standfirst: Luxury department store says passwords and payment details were not affected in the ‘isolated incident’Harrods has warned some customers that their personal data may have been taken in an IT breach, after a system belonging to one of its third-party providers was compromised.Information such as names and contact details of its e-commerce customers was taken, the luxury department store in Knightsbridge, London, said. Continue reading...
items.content: Luxury department store says passwords and payment details were not affected in the ‘isolated incident’Harrods has warned some customers that their personal data may have been taken in an IT breach, after a system belonging to one of its third-party providers was compromised.Information such as names and contact details of its e-commerce customers was taken, the luxury department store in Knightsbridge, London, said. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Harrods department store was contacted by hackers after a data breach.
The breach affected 430,000 customer records.
Harrods stated it would not engage with the "threat actor."
The affected data included basic customer details.
The breach occurred after a system of a third-party provider was compromised.

clusters.title: Denmark bans civilian drone flights for EU summit after new sightings
clusters.neutral_headline: Denmark Bans Drones Ahead of EU Summit

items.title: Denmark bans civilian drone flights for EU summit after new sightings
items.standfirst: Denmark on Sunday ordered a ban on civilian drone flights in the coming week as a security measure ahead of an EU summit in Copenhagen. The ban came after mysterious drones were observed over Danish military sites overnight for a second straight day, raising concerns in northern Europe amid suspected Russian involvement.
items.content: Denmark on Sunday ordered a ban on civilian drone flights in the coming week as a security measure ahead of an EU summit in Copenhagen. The ban came after mysterious drones were observed over Danish military sites overnight for a second straight day, raising concerns in northern Europe amid suspected Russian involvement.

items.title: Denmark reports more drone sightings ahead of European summits
items.standfirst: Civilian unmanned flights to be banned during gathering of heads of EU governments amid spate of drone incursions Danish authorities have said drones were seen at several military sites overnight and announced that all civilian use of the unmanned aircraft will be banned this week, as Copenhagen prepares to host two European summits.The Danish defence ministry said on Sunday it had observed drones at several of its armed forces locations on Saturday night, without giving further details. The transport ministry said all civilian use of drones would be banned to ensure security while Denmark hosts an EU summit and a meeting of the European Political Community, a wider gathering of leaders from across the continent. Continue reading...
items.content: Civilian unmanned flights to be banned during gathering of heads of EU governments amid spate of drone incursions Danish authorities have said drones were seen at several military sites overnight and announced that all civilian use of the unmanned aircraft will be banned this week, as Copenhagen prepares to host two European summits.The Danish defence ministry said on Sunday it had observed drones at several of its armed forces locations on Saturday night, without giving further details. The transport ministry said all civilian use of drones would be banned to ensure security while Denmark hosts an EU summit and a meeting of the European Political Community, a wider gathering of leaders from across the continent. Continue reading...

items.title: Denmark bans drone flights after latest drone sightings at military bases
items.standfirst: Drone sorties over past week have caused the temporary closures of several Danish airports, raising security concerns.
items.content: Drone sorties over past week have caused the temporary closures of several Danish airports, raising security concerns.

items.title: Denmark bans civil drones for a week after sightings over military bases
items.standfirst: Danish government says security measures are required ahead of two summits of European leaders
items.content: Danish government says security measures are required ahead of two summits of European leaders

ai_summary: Denmark banned civilian drone flights for an upcoming EU summit.
The ban followed drone sightings near Danish military sites.
The ban is a security measure for the EU summit in Copenhagen.
The Danish defense ministry observed drones at military locations.
The summit will include EU leaders and a meeting of the European Political Community.

items.standfirst: US president reverses course days after scrapping meeting to discuss crisis with Hakeem Jeffries and Chuck SchumerDonald Trump has reversed course and is purportedly planning to host a bipartisan gathering of the top four US congressional leaders at the White House on Monday afternoon in a last-ditch effort to avoid a looming government shutdown, the House speaker and the US president’s fellow Republican Mike Johnson said on Sunday.Trump’s climbdown comes days after he scrapped a planned meeting to discuss the crisis with Hakeem Jeffries and Chuck Schumer, the respective Democratic minority leaders in the House and Senate. Continue reading...
